column4: I installed ubuntu as a program in vista. I did not give ubuntu a partition: how can I give the "program ubuntu" access to more disk space?
I installed ubuntu as a program in vista. I did not give ubuntu a partition: how can I give the "program ubuntu" access to more disk space?
You could mount the ubuntu image and copy it to a bigger image file, for example. But that is not too easy so you should be comfortable with the command line for that.
Hm. Sorry, can't think of an easier way right now (although there probably is one ^^)
